It seems the escorts were still operating a few quaint Autocannons, and had ran out of ammunition during the fight. Upon examining the weapon, you discover it is still in functional order, albeit dry on ammunition, and is ready to be installed!

choice.text: Take time to investigate one of the Transports.
(Slug Crew) When docking with the escort, your Slug sensed something.

event.text: You heed your Slug's advice and follow their directions to where the lifesource is, where you find a man hunched over a weapon console. Although not in as severe a condition as initially expected, but any longer and they would've most likely not made it. They sincerely thank you for saving them when you did and offer to join your crew. "I was a gunnery officer aboard our ship, consider myself somewhat of a crack shot too 'till we began running dry towards the end of our caravans journey. Now I wish to pick up where I left off and make the universe a safer place from these raiders."

event.name: GB_MILITIA_ESCORT
event.text: The source of the distress beacon is emanating from a small Militia Escort. "We're very low on fuel and need some repairs desperately. Could you possibly take us to the nearest repair platform?"
"Thank you very much. I'm sure we can arrange some remuneration at the shipyards."
"Ok?... We'll just, uhh, die here then." The Militiamen seem to understand that supplies are tight and your route is already set. They turn off comms.

choice.text: Do something on board the ship.

event.text: You've decided that, instead of helping the Militiamen, you'll brutally attack them instead.

event.name: GB_QUEST_MILITIA_ESCORT
event.text: You've arrived at the shipyards, and receive a message from the Militiamen, thanking you. They dispatch a shipwright to install a specialized piece of equipment on your ship.

event.name: GB_FED_BOMBER_DISTRESS
event.text: You arrive at the beacon, only to find a Federation Bomber with its hull in tatters. Upon hailing, they explain that they had a run-in with some Mantis and are desperately low on munitions.

choice.text: Give them a small amount of ammo. [-3}]

event.text: It isn't much, but it's all you can spare. Hopefully it'll be enough to keep them alive until a supply convoy finds its way here. The crew offer a few spare droneparts to recompense.

choice.text: Give them a medium amount of ammo. [-5}]

event.text: "Thank you, sir. This should be plenty to get us out of this hellhole." The crew dispense an augment to help you on your mission.

choice.text: Give them a large amount of ammo. [-10}]

event.text: You hand over a significant amount of ammunition to the stranded Federation soldiers. Their captain messages you: "We don't have much to give, but we could probably spare one of our weapons. The other 3 should be plenty."
"You can just... make ammo? Man, why haven't we ever got one of these? We'd be happy to buy it off you if you can spare it. We have scrap.
You decide you need the Recycler more than these stranded soldiers and prepare to move on.

You hand over your ammo crate to the stranded Federation soldiers. Their captain messages you: "We don't have much to give, but we could probably spare one of our weapons. The other 3 should be plenty."
"We understand. Fly safe." The Federation ship terminates the hail. You can hear only the vast nothingness of space.

choice.text: Do something on board the ship.
If they're low on ammo, they're an easy target. Attack!

event.text: You power up your weapons and prepare to obliterate your allies.

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: The Rebel will escape as soon as this timer runs out.

event.name: GB_RAILGUN_FIELD_TEST
event.text: This is where the station reported rebel activity, and sure enough, a scout comes in to intercept you almost immediately. Time to show them who's boss.

FTL.event: A successful test of the new prototype arsenal leaving the familiar orange hull of the Rebel ship littered with suitable salvage. Hopefully the combat recordings of this field test would prove satisfactory.- standard

event.name: GB_RAIL_TEST_REBEL_ESCAPE
event.text: The rebels jump away, and you sense you lost valuable time on the fleet.
The commander of the station is unimpressed, and orders the prototype weapon to be returned immediately.

event.name: GB_MUSEUM_TOUR
event.text: This planet hosts a large human settlement, covering a large portion of the surface. The landscape is covered in sprawling urban landscapes cradled between towering peaks on the supercontinent. Standing tall amid the city is a grand building, surrounded by fountains and seemingly the centre of attention.

choice.text: Land and look around the building.

event.text: A grizzled Federation officer is guarding the front of the complex, allowing select members of the public to pass through into the halls beyond. You and your crew approach, and, recognising your uniforms, the officer stands aside to let you pass.

You enter into the atrium, where you see many great displays of equipment of various points of the Federation's timespan in this Universe. Some things depicted here, especially the events do not line up perfectly with what you are familiar with in your universe. You aren't sure if that's due to errors of the displays or a divergence in the timeline between this and your universe. Entering the main corridor, you realise that this is a museum, built to contain old Federation memorabilia. A curator scuttles up to you, and, seeing your insignia, asks if they can provide anything to assist with your mission - for a price.

choice.text: Take a tour around the museum. WARNING, DOES NOTHING FOR NOW
Let's get straight to business, shall we?

event.text: Whilst it might be quite the sight, you don't have time to waste on tourism.

event.name: GB_MUSEUM_PURCHASE_DONATE
event.text: The curator bows obsequiously, and leads you into a dusty storeroom, where a variety of antique weapons are hanging on the walls, neatly categorised by year and users. You note that the 'Federation' section is rather empty. "I, sir, would be delighted to assist you in any way. Well, any way that helps us both."

choice.text: Offer to purchase a weapon from the collection.

event.text: "We've sold and traded many items from our inventory over the years, but never have I thought of something from our collection going out back into battle."

choice.text: (Federation Elite Crew) Requisition a weapon from the collection.

event.text: With the Federations supply shortage of weapons, they passed a resolution that allows their Elites and Officers to requisition former Federation equipment.

choice.text: Donate a weapon to the museum.

event.text: The curator seems rather shocked when you offer to donate some of your arsenal. "We thought the military didn't care about us any more... what with this Multiversal conflict going on, the last time a supply ship made it out this far was six months ago. Whilst it may not be food, we at The Federal War Museum would be delighted to take some equipment off you, captain."

choice.text: Donate your autocannon MK1 to the museum.

event.text: "Hmm. A mark one autocannon. Quite a poor specimen, as well." They grumble a little, but eventually you talk them into paying you for it.

choice.text: Donate your autocannon MK2 to the museum.

event.text: The curator stares when you offer your donation. "A mark two? In excellent condition, as well. I would be honoured to take this off your hands, captain."

choice.text: Donate your autocannon MK3 to the museum.

event.text: "Oh my, oh my! A mark three. Gosh, I haven't seen one of these for... oh, must be twenty years. A little beat-up I see, but this would be a prize addition to our collection here." They offer you as much scrap as they can find in their vaults.
The museum drop off even more scrap as you leave the building.

Hello, one of our fuel tanks exploded while we were fighting against some rebel scum, we can't navigate propperly so the rest left us behind.

Thank you kind federation ship

event.text: You attempt to locate the source of the encrypted distress signal with short-range scans. A small Federation escort floats motionlessly amidst a cloud of gas. You tune in on Federation hailing frequencies: "Friendly vessel, this is the Federation ship Kaha'i. we've taken heavy damage and are leaking fuel. Requesting immediate assistance."

choice.text: (Repair Weapon) Use your equipment to repair the ship efficiently.

event.text: A few salvos of your repair weapon patch up the ship easily, sealing their hull and preventing any further leaking.

choice.text: (Repair Ammo Weapon) Use your munition based equipment to repair the ship efficiently.

event.text: A few salvos of your repair weapon patch up the ship easily, sealing their hull and preventing any further leaking.

choice.text: (Repair Arm) Use your repair arm to repair the vessel.

event.text: The repair arm works with machine precision. Using a moderate amount of scrap and debris, it seals their fuel tanks and any other breaches, preventing any further leaking.

choice.text: (Repair Drone) Use your repair drone to repair their damage.

event.text: Once dispatched, the drone makes short work of the damage. It seals their fuel tanks and any other breaches, preventing any further leaking.

choice.text: (Repair Crew) Use your trained crew to repair their damage.

event.text: You dock with the ship and send your crew member to repair the ship's damage. Their experience and proficiency makes short work of the breaches, quickly sealing their fuel tanks and preventing any further leaking.

choice.text: Take time to repair their ship.

event.text: The fleet will make some headway, but you can't just leave this Federation ship stranded here. You dock with the vessel and send a team aboard, diligently repairing the damage until it no longer leaks fuel.

You don't think they'll be too happy that you couldn't help, but you assure them that if you do encounter any friendly ships that you will forward them their way. Still though, you can't help but feel disappointed with yourself that you couldn't assist them.

event.name: RVS_FREIGHTER_ESCORT_DISTRESS_DEFAULT
event.text: "Much obliged friendly vessel, we should be in good enough shape to find somewhere to refuel. We'll send you all the scrap we can spare. Best of luck out there."

event.name: RVS_FREIGHTER_ESCORT_DISTRESS_OPTIONS
event.text: "Much obliged friendly vessel. We were left stranded after we were attacked by Rebel interceptors gunning it to a military convoy we were escorting. Those tossers blew our bloody fuel tanks right before we sent them packing. We're still in a sorry state, so I recommend you rendezvous with the convoy ASAP. It's imperative that they make it to their objective."

choice.text: Agree to rendezvous with the convoy.

event.text: You agree to rendezvous with the convoy and escort them to their destination.
With the amount of fuel they've lost in the explosion and subsequent leak, they're still far from full working order. You offer to refuel their ship so they can get back to the convoy.

choice.text: (Fuel Conserver) Offer them your fuel conserver.

event.text: With the amount of fuel they've lost in the explosion and subsequent leak, they're still far from full working order, but they still have enough fumes to make use of your fuel conserver. You offer to transfer it to them so they can get back to the convoy.

You don't think they'll be too happy that you couldn't help, but you assure them that if you do encounter any friendly ships that you will forward them their way. Still though, you can't help but feel disappointed with yourself that you couldn't assist them.

event.name: RVS_FREIGHTER_ESCORT_DISTRESS_OPTIONS_HELPED
event.text: "With this, we could manage to reconnect with the convoy! However, if that last encounter was anything to go by, we still would need all the help we can get. I can't stress enough how important this mission is."

choice.text: Agree to rendezvous with the convoy.

event.text: You agree to rendezvous with the convoy and escort them to their destination.

You have put considerable amount of time and resources into assisting the Federation ship and decide it is best to carry on and resume your mission, but you can't help but wonder what will happen to the convoy in your absence.

event.name: RVS_FREIGHTER_CONVOY
event.text: You arrive at the coordinates given to you by the escort to find a Federation military checkpoint. Federation vessels patrol the area, protecting a couple of armed orbital facilities. Outside of the heavy military traffic at this beacon it's a relatively unremarkable star system, though you can't seem to locate the convoy.

It doesn't take long before ships begin jumping into the system. A few freighters and transports arrive along with their escorts trickling in one after the other, until well over a dozen ships arrive. This must be the convoy you were sent to escort! "Multiverse Renegade, this is Supply Officer Kyrylo in command of the Federation ship Grebe. If I understand correctly, you are assigned to provide this convoy an additional escort, correct? Good. We've taken hits at nearly every turn and the Federation Fleet can't spare any of their ships in this sector. We can use all the help we can get, even if it's from a Renegade."
"Good, we'll transmit the coordinates for the next checkpoint. See you there."
You're sick and tired of anti-Renegade prejudice. You flip Kyrylo the bird and cut comms before he can respond.

If this convoy is important enough for the Rebels to try and prevent it from reaching its destination, it must be carrying something very valuable or powerful.
Kyrylo only looks somewhat suprised when you power your weapons and target the freighter. "Frankly, I don't understand why Universe 0 uses Renegades. You lot are no better than pirates." You detect weapons signatures all around you as the convoy's escort turns toward your ship. Hopefully the cargo is worth it...

event.name: RVS_FREIGHTER_DESTROYED
event.text: The freighter's cargo is scattered into space as it's blown apart. Without the right equipment, you won't be able to recover most of it before the Federation fleet blows your ship up too.
The magnet arm gathers some crates from the wreckage. Among the spoils you find an advanced ballistic weapon!

event.name: RVS_FREIGHTER_DEAD_CREW
event.text: With the crew of the freighter dead you can loot its cargo, but you'll likely take a beating from its escort while you do so.
You board the freighter and retrieve its cargo, your ship taking a few hits as you do. Among the spoils you find an advanced ballistic weapon!

choice.text: (Teleporter) Use your Teleporter to get in and out quickly.

event.text: Using the teleporter, you manage to relieve the freighter of its cargo before your ship can take any more of a beating. Among the spoils you find an advanced ballistic weapon!
You peal several chunks off the freighter's hull and prepare to jump away.

beaconType.undiscoveredTooltip: This is the location of a Federation checkpoint.
beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: This is the location of a Federation checkpoint.
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.name: RVS_FREIGHTER_CONVOY_CHECKPOINT_SAFE
event.text: You jump into a heavily militarised sector with the rest of the convoy following suit. The Federation checkpoint hails you, and after a quick exchange and flashing of IFF signals, you are welcomed to help yourself to a quick resupply and repair.

With all the heavy military traffic here it's almost a surprise how peaceful it is. It will be difficult for the Rebels to track you here, and the resistance they'll meet when they arrive will certainly keep them occupied.

event.name: RVS_FREIGHTER_CONVOY_CHECKPOINT_HOSTILE
event.text: You jump into a heavily militarised sector with the rest of the convoy following suit. The Federation checkpoint hails you, and after a quick exchange and flashing of IFF signals, you are welcomed to help yourself to a quick resupply and repair.

The perimeter alarms are set off as Rebels begin jumping into the system! Federation ships scramble to intercept, but a few of the Rebels leak through between the battle lines. You lock onto the biggest ship and move in to engage. You'll have to hold them off while the convoy charges up their FTL drives!

event.name: RVS_FREIGHTER_CONVOY_CHECKPOINT_JUMP_WARNING
event.text: If you leave now, the convoy will likely be overrun by the Rebels! You weigh your decision carefully...

event.name: RVS_FREIGHTER_CONVOY_CHECKPOINT_HOSTILE_FINISH_SUCCESS
event.text: With the Rebel elite dispatched, the convoy jumps away to the next checkpoint.

event.name: RVS_FREIGHTER_CONVOY_CHECKPOINT_HOSTILE_FINISH_FAILURE
event.text: The wrecked hulls of Federation vessels litter the surrounding space. It looks like any ships in the convoy that managed to survive the battle have already jumped away, leaving you uncertain as to weather they'll be able to complete their mission.

event.name: RVS_FREIGHTER_CONVOY_CHECKPOINT_FINAL
event.text: You were expecting to see a fully operational Forward Operating Base here and an attachment of ships. However, you are met with disaster as signs of a recent battle litter this system with all reactor signatures showing dead, except a squadron of Rebel ships eager to pounce on their prey! "Renegade! This is Supply Officer Kyrylo hailing. Mission aborted! The FOB is destroyed. I repeat, the FOB is destroyed. There's nothing left here for us. We're exfiltrating immediately, but the Rebels are jamming our drives! You need to buy us some time."
While the escorts engage the lighter enemy ships, you take on the biggest ship and draw its fire away from the convoy. You'll have to make this quick or the convoy will take significant damage!

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: Time until the convoy takes significant damage.

event.text: As you move to engage the cruiser, a familiar escort ship breaks off from the convoy. "Friendly vessel, this is the Kaha'i. We'll provide what fire support we can, let's show these blighters how wrong they were to mess with us!"
There's no way you're fighting this monstrosity. You move away from the battle and try not to think about the convoy being torn to pieces as the FTL drive charges.

event.name: RVS_FREIGHTER_CONVOY_DAMAGED
event.text: You've been fighting the enemy cruiser so long that the convoy has taken a severe beating from the other ships, but they're still alive. If you can't defeat the cruiser soon, the convoy will surely be destroyed.

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: Time until the convoy is destroyed.

event.name: RVS_FREIGHTER_CONVOY_DESTROYED
event.text: You watch in horror as the convoy's ships are blown apart one by one, powerless to stop it. With their mission completed, the enemy ships jump away. There's nothing for it but to scrap the debris and move on. You have your own mission to complete, and with any luck the Federation can still be saved.

event.name: RVS_FREIGHTER_CONVOY_SAVED_NODAMAGE
event.text: Without the crusier to support them, you and the convoy's escort are easily able to chase away the remaining ships. "Thanks for the help Renegade, you really saved our hides. We were transporting some advanced weapons to the FOB to outfit the fleet. You're not exactly part of the fleet, but I think we can make an exception in your case."

"Since FOB is gone, we'll have to reroute directly to Node 17. We should be able to make our own way from here, I doubt we'll meet any more resistance quite like that." You and Kyrylo wish each other luck on your respective missions and the convoy jumps away, leaving you a little more hopeful that you'll be able to save this universe's Federation.

event.name: RVS_FREIGHTER_CONVOY_SAVED_DAMAGE
event.text: Without the crusier to support them, you and the convoy's escort are easily able to chase away the remaining ships. "Thanks for the help Renegade. We're not in great shape, but we're still kicking. Now that the FOB is gone, we'll have to reroute directly to Node 17 to deliver our cargo. I doubt we'll meet any more resistance quite like that, we should be able to make it on our own from here." You and Kyrylo wish each other luck on your respective missions and the convoy jumps away, leaving you a little more hopeful that you'll be able to save this universe's Federation.
